OBJECT_IDS.description: Specific NORAD IDs or catalog numbers

DataCoverage.description: Data coverage combining spatial and temporal

PRICE_AMOUNT.description: Price in smallest unit (cents, satoshis, etc.)

RATE_LIMIT.description: Rate limit in requests per hour

FEATURES.description: List of features included in this tier

PROVIDER_PEER_ID.description: Peer ID of the data provider

PROVIDER_EPM_CID.description: IPFS CID of provider's EPM (Entity Profile Message)

DESCRIPTION.description: Detailed description of the data offering

ENCRYPTION_REQUIRED.description: Whether encryption is required for data delivery

CREATED_AT.description: Unix timestamp when listing was created

UPDATED_AT.description: Unix timestamp when listing was last updated

ACTIVE.description: Whether the listing is currently active

ACL.description: Access Control Grant - Permission to access purchased data

LISTING_ID.description: ID of the listing this grant applies to

BUYER_ENCRYPTION_PUBKEY.description: Buyer's encryption public key for encrypted delivery

TIER_NAME.description: Name of the pricing tier purchased

GRANTED_AT.description: Unix timestamp when access was granted

EXPIRES_AT.description: Unix timestamp when access expires (0 = never expires)

PAYMENT_TX_HASH.description: Transaction hash or reference proving payment

CP_X.description: Center of pressure X in m

CP_Y.description: Center of pressure Y in m

CP_Z.description: Center of pressure Z in m

IXX.description: Moment of inertia about X axis in kg*m^2

IYY.description: Moment of inertia about Y axis in kg*m^2

IZZ.description: Moment of inertia about Z axis in kg*m^2

IXY.description: Product of inertia XY in kg*m^2

IXZ.description: Product of inertia XZ in kg*m^2

IYZ.description: Product of inertia YZ in kg*m^2

TOR_1.description: Torque about body X in N*m

TOR_2.description: Torque about body Y in N*m

TOR_3.description: Torque about body Z in N*m

STEP_SIZE.description: Time interval between attitude states in seconds (required).

ATTITUDE_COMPONENTS.description:
Number of components per attitude state.
7 = quaternion + angular rates (Q1, Q2, Q3, QC, RATE_X, RATE_Y, RATE_Z)
4 = quaternion only (Q1, Q2, Q3, QC)

ATTITUDE_DATA.description:
Attitude data as row-major array of doubles.
Layout: [Q1_0, Q2_0, Q3_0, QC_0, RATE_X_0, RATE_Y_0, RATE_Z_0, Q1_1, ...]
Time reconstruction: epoch[i] = START_TIME + (i * STEP_SIZE)
Length must be divisible by ATTITUDE_COMPONENTS.

SOURCE_ID.description: Reference to source imagery (e.g., SKI, GDI, EOO)

YEAR.description: Four-digit year identifying the model version (e.g., 1970, 2008, 2020)

GAIN.description: Gain level in dBi at this contour

EIRP.description: EIRP at beam center in dBW

G_OVER_T.description: G/T at beam center in dB/K

WET_MASS.description: Maximum wet mass (with propellant) in kg

FrequencyRange.description: Frequency range with lower and upper limits

StokesParameters.description: Stokes parameters, representing different aspects of polarization

U.description: Another linear polarization, orthogonal to Q

Band.description: Table representing a frequency band with a name and frequency range

DATA_MODE.description: Mode of the data (real, simulated, synthetic)

POWER_TYPE.description: Type of power (eg. AC or DC)

TRANSMIT.description: Indicates if the EMT can transmit

RECEIVE.description: Indicates if the EMT can receive

TASKABLE.description: Indicates if the site is taskable

OBJECT_TYPE.description: Object type (Payload, Rocket body, Debris, Unknown)

RCS.description: Radar Cross Section [meters2]; blank if no data available

ORBIT_TYPE.description: Orbit type (Orbit, Landing, Impact, Docked to RSO, roundtrip)

MANEUVERABLE.description: Indicates if the object is maneuverable

SIZE.description: Size [meters]; blank if no data available

MASS.description: Mass [kilograms]; blank if no data available

MULTIFORMAT_ADDRESS.description:
Multiformat Address
https://multiformats.io/multiaddr/
A universal address format for representing multiple network protocols. Examples include:
- /ip4/192.168.1.1/tcp/80 for an IPv4 address with TCP protocol
- /ip6zone/x/ip6/::1 for an IPv6 address with a zone
- /dns4/example.com for a domain name resolvable only to IPv4 addresses
- /ipfs/bafybeiccfclkdtucu6y4yc5cpr6y3yuinr67svmii46v5cfcrkp47ihehy/README.txt -IPFS address w/CID and path to `README.txt`.

PUBLISH_TIMESTAMP.description: Publish Time OF THE Publish Notification Message

CID.description:
Concatenated Content Identifier (CID)
This field is a unique ID for distributed systems (CID).
The CID provides a unique identifier within distributed systems, as detailed at https://github.com/multiformats/cid.

FILE_NAME.description:
File ID
This field is the Name

FILE_ID.description:
File ID
This field is the file ID / Standard Type

SIGNATURE.description:
Digital Signature of the CID
This is the digital signature of the CID, signed using the specified cryptographic method.

TIMESTAMP_SIGNATURE.description:
Timestamp Signature
Digital signature of the publish timestamp, using the specified cryptographic method for timestamp verification.

SIGNATURE_TYPE.description:
Type of Cryptographic Signature Used
Specifies the type of cryptographic signature used for the SIGNATURE field, indicating the specific blockchain technology, such as Ethereum or BTC.

TIMESTAMP_SIGNATURE_TYPE.description:
Type of Cryptographic Signature Used for Timestamp
Specifies the type of cryptographic signature used for the TIMESTAMP_SIGNATURE field, indicating the specific blockchain technology, such as Ethereum or BTC.

PUBLIC_KEY.description: Public part of the cryptographic key, in hexidecimal format

PRIVATE_KEY.description: Private part of the cryptographic key in hexidecimal format, should be kept secret

KEY_ADDRESS.description: Address generated from the cryptographic key

ADDRESS_TYPE.description: Type of the address generated from the cryptographic key

KEY_TYPE.description: Type of the cryptographic key (signing or encryption)

REGION.description: Region of the address (e.g., state or province)

LOCALITY.description: Locality of the address (e.g., city or town)

LEGAL_NAME.description: Common name of the entity (person or organization)

FAMILY_NAME.description: Family name or surname of the person

GIVEN_NAME.description: Given name or first name of the person

ADDITIONAL_NAME.description: Additional name or middle name of the person

HONORIFIC_PREFIX.description: Honorific prefix preceding the person's name (e.g., Mr., Dr.)

HONORIFIC_SUFFIX.description: Honorific suffix following the person's name (e.g., Jr., Sr.)

KEYS.description: Cryptographic keys associated with the entity

MULTIFORMAT_ADDRESS.description: Multiformat addresses associated with the entity

REFERENCE_FRAME.description: Reference Frame in which the object position is defined

AREA_SRP.description: Area of the object solar radiation pressure

X.description: X-coordinate of the object's position in RTN coordinates

Y.description: Y-coordinate of the object's position in RTN

Z.description: Z-coordinate of the object's position in RTN

X_DOT.description: X-coordinate of the object's position in RTN coordinates

Y_DOT.description: Y-coordinate of the object's position in RTN

Z_DOT.description: Z-coordinate of the object's position in RTN

COVARIANCE.description:
Covariance matrix as flat array (9x9 lower triangular = 45 elements).
Order: [CR_R, CT_R, CT_T, CN_R, CN_T, CN_N, CRDOT_R, CRDOT_T, CRDOT_N, CRDOT_RDOT,
CTDOT_R, CTDOT_T, CTDOT_N, CTDOT_RDOT, CTDOT_TDOT,
CNDOT_R, CNDOT_T, CNDOT_N, CNDOT_RDOT, CNDOT_TDOT, CNDOT_NDOT,
CDRG_R, CDRG_T, CDRG_N, CDRG_RDOT, CDRG_TDOT, CDRG_NDOT, CDRG_DRG,
CSRP_R, CSRP_T, CSRP_N, CSRP_RDOT, CSRP_TDOT, CSRP_NDOT, CSRP_DRG, CSRP_SRP,
CTHR_R, CTHR_T, CTHR_N, CTHR_RDOT, CTHR_TDOT, CTHR_NDOT, CTHR_DRG, CTHR_SRP, CTHR_THR]

CCSDS_CDM_VERS.description: The version of the CCSDS CDM standard used

CREATION_DATE.description: The date the CDM message was created

ORIGINATOR.description: The originator of the CDM message

MESSAGE_FOR.description: The intended recipient of the CDM message

MESSAGE_ID.description: A unique identifier for the CDM message

MISS_DISTANCE.description: The miss distance between the two objects

RELATIVE_SPEED.description: The relative speed between the two objects

START_SCREEN_PERIOD.description: The start time of the screening period

STOP_SCREEN_PERIOD.description: The end time of the screening period

SCREEN_VOLUME_FRAME.description: The reference frame for the screening volume

SCREEN_VOLUME_SHAPE.description: The shape of the screening volume

SCREEN_VOLUME_X.description: The X dimension of the screening volume

SCREEN_VOLUME_Y.description: The Y dimension of the screening volume

SCREEN_VOLUME_Z.description: The Z dimension of the screening volume

SCREEN_ENTRY_TIME.description: The time the objects entered the screening volume

SCREEN_EXIT_TIME.description: The time the objects exited the screening volume

COLLISION_PROBABILITY.description: The probability of collision between the two objects

COLLISION_PROBABILITY_METHOD.description: The method used to calculate the collision probability

OBJECT1.description: The first object in the CDM message

OBJECT2.description: The second object in the CDM message

OBJECT1_DATASOURCE.description: Data Source for the positional information for Object 1

OBJECT2_DATASOURCE.description: Data Source for the positional information for Object 2

BAND.description: Operating band (e.g., C, Ku, Ka, L, S, X)

UPLINK_FREQ_MIN.description: Uplink frequency range minimum in MHz

UPLINK_FREQ_MAX.description: Uplink frequency range maximum in MHz

DOWNLINK_FREQ_MIN.description: Downlink frequency range minimum in MHz

DOWNLINK_FREQ_MAX.description: Downlink frequency range maximum in MHz

MISSION.description: Primary mission (e.g., FIXED_SAT, BROADCAST, MOBILE, RELAY, MILSATCOM)

ID.description: Unique identifier of the record, auto-generated by the system.

CLASSIFICATION.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

TYPE.description: The type of this collect or contact request.

ID_PLAN.description: Unique identifier of the parent plan or schedule associated with this request.

PLAN_INDEX.description: Index number for records within a collection plan or schedule.

TASK_ID.description: Task ID associated with this request.

DWELL_ID.description: The dwell ID associated with this request.

ID_SENSOR.description: Unique identifier of the requested/scheduled/planned sensor associated with this request.

ORIG_SENSOR_ID.description: Optional identifier provided by the source to indicate the sensor identifier requested/scheduled/planned for this request.

PRIORITY.description: The priority of the collect request.

TASK_CATEGORY.description: The tasking category associated with this request.

SUFFIX.description: The tasking suffix associated with this request.

UCT_FOLLOW_UP.description: Boolean indicating that this collect request is UCT follow-up.

START_TIME.description: The start time of the collect or contact request window, in ISO 8601 UTC format.

END_TIME.description: The end time of the collect or contact request window, in ISO 8601 UTC format.

NORAD_CAT_ID.description: Satellite/catalog number of the target on-orbit object for this request.

ORIG_OBJECT_ID.description: Optional identifier provided by the data source to indicate the target object of this request.

TASK_GROUP.description: The tasking group to which the target object is assigned.

ORBIT_REGIME.description: The orbit regime of the target.

TARGET_SIZE.description: The minimum object (diameter) size, in meters, to be reported.

RCS_MIN.description: The minimum Radar Cross-Section of the target, in m^2.

RCS.description: The Radar Cross-Section of the target, in m^2.

RCS_MAX.description: The maximum Radar Cross-Section of the target, in m^2.

FREQ_MIN.description: The minimum frequency of interest, in MHz.

FREQ.description: The estimated or expected emission frequency of the target, in MHz.

FREQ_MAX.description: The maximum frequency of interest, in MHz.

VIS_MAG_MIN.description: The minimum estimated or expected visual magnitude of the target, in Magnitudes (M).

VIS_MAG.description: The estimated or expected visual magnitude of the target, in Magnitudes (M).

VIS_MAG_MAX.description: The maximum estimated or expected visual magnitude of the target, in Magnitudes (M).

SPECTRAL_MODEL.description: The spectral model used for the irradiance calculation.

REFLECTANCE.description: The fraction of solar energy reflected from target.

NUM_FRAMES.description: For optical sensors, the requested number of frames to capture at each sensor step.

FRAME_RATE.description: For optical sensors, the frame rate of the camera, in Hz.

INTEGRATION_TIME.description: For optical sensors, the integration time per camera frame, in milliseconds.

NUM_TRACKS.description: The number of requested tracks on the target.

NUM_OBS.description: The number of requested observations on the target.

DURATION.description: The duration of the collect request, in seconds.

SRCH_PATTERN.description: The search pattern to be executed for this request.

SCENARIO.description: Pre-coordinated code, direction, or configuration to be executed by the sensor or site for this collect or contact.

ID_ELSET.description: ID of the Elset of the object associated with this request.

ID_MANIFOLD.description: ID of the Manifold Elset of the object associated with this request.

ID_STATE_VECTOR.description: ID of the State Vector of the object or central vector associated with this request.

ES_ID.description: ID of the Ephemeris Set of the object associated with this request.

EPOCH.description: Epoch time, in ISO 8601 UTC format, of the orbital elements.

SEMI_MAJOR_AXIS.description: The average of the periapsis and apoapsis distances, in kilometers.

ECCENTRICITY.description: The orbital eccentricity of an astronomical object.

INCLINATION.description: The angle, in degrees, between the equator and the orbit plane.

RAAN.description: Right ascension of the ascending node, in degrees.

ARG_OF_PERIGEE.description: The argument of perigee, in degrees.

MEAN_ANOMALY.description: The mean anomaly defines the angular position, in degrees, of the object on its orbital path.

RA.description: The expected or directed right ascension angle, in degrees.

DEC.description: The expected or directed declination angle, in degrees.

AZ.description: The expected or directed azimuth angle, in degrees.

EL.description: The expected or directed elevation angle, in degrees.

RANGE.description: The expected acquisition range or defined center range, in km.

EXTENT_AZ.description: The extent of the azimuth angle, in degrees, from center azimuth.

EXTENT_EL.description: The extent of the elevation angle, in degrees, from center elevation.

EXTENT_RANGE.description: The extent of the range, in km, from center range.

ALT.description: Height above WGS-84 ellipsoid (HAE), in kilometers.

STOP_LAT.description: The stopping WGS-84 latitude of a volume definition, in degrees.

STOP_LON.description: The stopping WGS-84 longitude of a volume definition, in degrees.

STOP_ALT.description: The stopping HAE WGS-84 height above ellipsoid (HAE), in kilometers.

SRCH_INC.description: The maximum inclination, in degrees, to be used in search operations.

X_ANGLE.description: The angular distance, in degrees, in the sensor-x direction from scan center.

Y_ANGLE.description: The angular distance, in degrees, in the sensor-y direction from scan center.

ORIENT_ANGLE.description: The magnitude of rotation, in degrees, between the xAngle direction and locally defined equinoctial plane.

NOTES.description: Notes or comments associated with this request.

ORIGIN.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source.

DATA_MODE.description: Indicator of whether the data is EXERCISE, REAL, SIMULATED, or TEST data.

OBJECT_1.description: Satellite name for the first object

DSE_1.description: Days since epoch for the first object

OBJECT_2.description: Satellite name for the second object

DSE_2.description: Days since epoch for the second object

TCA.description: Time of closest approach as a Unix timestamp

TCA_RANGE.description: The distance or range between the two objects at TCA

TCA_RELATIVE_SPEED.description: The magnitude of the relative velocity at TCA

DILUTION.description: Standard deviation that produces the maximum probability

MEAN_LONGITUDE.description: Current mean longitude in degrees East

SLOT_CENTER.description: Longitude slot center in degrees East (if station-keeping)

ENCRYPTED_BLOB.description: Encrypted data blob, containing the ciphertext of the original plaintext message.

EPHEMERAL_PUBLIC_KEY.description: Temporary public key used for the encryption session, contributing to the derivation of the shared secret.

MAC.description: Message Authentication Code to verify the integrity and authenticity of the encrypted message.

NONCE_START.description: Random 12-byte nonce starting value. Incremented for each record in the stream to ensure unique nonces.

TAG.description: Additional authentication tag used in some encryption schemes for integrity and authenticity verification.

IV.description: Initialization vector used to introduce randomness in the encryption process, enhancing security.

SALT.description: Cryptographic salt used in key derivation (e.g. HKDF) to ensure unique key material per session.

PUBLIC_KEY_IDENTIFIER.description: Identifier for the public key used, aiding in recipient key management and message decryption.

CIPHER_SUITE.description: Specifies the set of cryptographic algorithms used in the encryption process.

KDF_PARAMETERS.description: Parameters for the Key Derivation Function, guiding the process of deriving keys from the shared secret.

ENCRYPTION_ALGORITHM_PARAMETERS.description: Parameters defining specific settings for the encryption algorithm, such as block size or operation mode.

ENC.description: Encryption Header containing all parameters needed for decryption

EPHEMERAL_PUBLIC_KEY.description: Ephemeral public key for ECDH key agreement (32-65 bytes depending on algorithm)

NONCE_START.description: Random 12-byte nonce starting value. Incremented for each record in the stream to ensure unique nonces.

RECIPIENT_KEY_ID.description: Optional identifier for the recipient's public key (up to 32 bytes)

SCHEMA_HASH.description: Optional SHA-256 hash of the FlatBuffers schema (32 bytes)

ROOT_TYPE.description: Optional root type name from the schema

TIMESTAMP.description: Optional Unix timestamp (milliseconds) when encryption was performed

CLASSIFICATION.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

OB_TIME.description: Ob detection time in ISO 8601 UTC (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.ssssssZ), up to microsecond precision.

CORR_QUALITY.description: Correlation score of the observation when compared to a known orbit state.

ID_ON_ORBIT.description: Server will auto-populate with SAT_NO if available.

SENSOR_ID.description: Unique ID of the sensor. Must have a corresponding sensor record on the server.

NORAD_CAT_ID.description: 18SDS satellite number. Only list if correlated against the 18SDS catalog.

TASK_ID.description: Identifier for the collectRequest message if the collection was in response to tasking.

TRANSACTION_ID.description: Optional identifier to track a transaction.

IMAGE_SET_ID.description: The user-defined set ID of a sequence of images.

IMAGE_SET_LENGTH.description: The number of images in an image set.

SEQUENCE_ID.description: The sequence ID of an image within an image set.

OB_POSITION.description: The position of this observation within a track (FENCE, FIRST, IN, LAST, SINGLE).

ORIG_OBJECT_ID.description: Provider maintained ID. May not be consistent with 18SDS SAT_NO.

UCT.description: Required if correlation is attempted. Indicates whether correlation succeeded.

AZIMUTH.description: Line of sight azimuth angle in degrees and topocentric frame.

AZIMUTH_UNC.description: One sigma uncertainty in the line of sight azimuth angle, in degrees.

AZIMUTH_BIAS.description: Sensor line of sight azimuth angle bias in degrees.

AZIMUTH_RATE.description: Rate of change of the line of sight azimuth in degrees per second.

ELEVATION.description: Line of sight elevation in degrees and topocentric frame.

ELEVATION_UNC.description: One sigma uncertainty in the line of sight elevation angle, in degrees.

ELEVATION_BIAS.description: Sensor line of sight elevation bias in degrees.

ELEVATION_RATE.description: Rate of change of the line of sight elevation in degrees per second.

RANGE.description: Line of sight range in km. Reported value should include all applicable corrections.

RANGE_UNC.description: One sigma uncertainty in the line of sight range, in km.

RANGE_BIAS.description: Sensor line of sight range bias in km.

RANGE_RATE.description: Range rate in km/s. Reported value should include all applicable corrections.

RANGE_RATE_UNC.description: One sigma uncertainty in the line of sight range rate, in km/sec.

RA.description: Right ascension in degrees. Required metric reporting field for EO observations.

RA_RATE.description: Line of sight right ascension rate of change, in degrees/sec.

RA_UNC.description: One sigma uncertainty in the line of sight right ascension angle, in degrees.

RA_BIAS.description: Sensor line of sight right ascension bias in degrees.

DECLINATION.description: Declination in degrees. Required metric reporting field for EO observations.

DECLINATION_RATE.description: Line of sight declination rate of change, in degrees/sec.

DECLINATION_UNC.description: One sigma uncertainty in the line of sight declination angle, in degrees.

DECLINATION_BIAS.description: Sensor line of sight declination angle bias in degrees.

LOSX.description: X-component of the unit vector representing the line-of-sight direction in the observer's reference frame.

LOSY.description: Y-component of the unit vector representing the line-of-sight direction in the observer's reference frame.

LOSZ.description: Z-component of the unit vector representing the line-of-sight direction in the observer's reference frame.

LOS_UNC.description: One sigma uncertainty in the line-of-sight direction vector components.

LOSXVEL.description: X-component of the velocity vector along the line of sight, in km/s.

LOSYVEL.description: Y-component of the velocity vector along the line of sight, in km/s.

LOSZVEL.description: Z-component of the velocity vector along the line of sight, in km/s.

SENLAT.description: WGS-84 latitude in decimal degrees at the time of the observation.

SENLON.description: WGS-84 longitude in decimal degrees at the time of the observation.

SENALT.description: Sensor height in km relative to the WGS-84 ellipsoid at the time of the observation.

SENX.description: Cartesian X position in km at the time of the observation.

SENY.description: Cartesian Y position in km at the time of the observation.

SENZ.description: Cartesian Z position in km at the time of the observation.

FOV_COUNT.description: Total number of satellites in the field of view.

FOV_COUNT_UCTS.description: Number of uncorrelated satellites in the field of view (JCO).

EXP_DURATION.description:
Image exposure duration in seconds. For observations performed using frame stacking or synthetic tracking methods,
the exposure duration should be the total integration time. This field is highly recommended / required if the
observations are going to be used for photometric processing.

NET_OBJ_SIG_UNC.description: Net object signature uncertainty = counts uncertainty / EXP_DURATION.

MAG.description: Measure of observed brightness calibrated against the Gaia G-band.

GEOLAT.description:
Computed estimate of the latitude, positive degrees north. It should be computed based on the assumed slant range
and corresponding viewing geometry. It must NOT be computed from the orbit state.

GEOLON.description:
Computed estimate of the longitude as +/- 180 degrees east. It should be computed based on the assumed slant range
and viewing geometry. It must NOT be computed from the orbit state.

GEOALT.description: Computed estimate of satellite altitude in km at the reported location. It must NOT be computed from the orbit state.

GEORANGE.description: Computed estimate of the slant range in km. It must NOT be computed from the orbit state.

SKY_BKGRND.description:
Average Sky Background signal, in Magnitudes. Sky Background refers to the incoming light from an apparently
empty part of the night sky.

PRIMARY_EXTINCTION.description:
Primary Extinction Coefficient, in Magnitudes. Primary Extinction is the coefficient applied to the airmass
to determine how much the observed visual magnitude has been attenuated by the atmosphere. Extinction, in general,
describes the absorption and scattering of electromagnetic radiation by dust and gas between an emitting astronomical
object and the observer.

PRIMARY_EXTINCTION_UNC.description: Primary Extinction Coefficient Uncertainty, in Magnitudes.

SOLAR_PHASE_ANGLE.description:
The angle, in degrees, between the target-to-observer vector and the target-to-sun vector. Recommend using the
calculation listed in the EOSSA documentation, pg 106 of the EOSSA spec.

SOLAR_EQ_PHASE_ANGLE.description:
The angle, in degrees, between the projections of the target-to-observer vector and the target-to-sun vector
onto the equatorial plane. The convention used is negative when closing (i.e., before the opposition)
and positive when opening (after the opposition).

SOLAR_DEC_ANGLE.description: Angle from the sun to the equatorial plane.

RAW_FILE_URI.description: Optional URI location in the document repository of the raw file parsed by the system to produce this record.

INTENSITY.description: Intensity of the target for IR observations, in kw/sr/em.

BG_INTENSITY.description: Background intensity for IR observations, in kw/sr/um.

DESCRIPTOR.description: Optional source-provided and searchable metadata or descriptor of the data.

ORIGIN.description:
Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source.
The origin may be different than the source if the source was a mediating system which forwarded
the data on behalf of the origin system. If null, the source may be assumed to be the origin.

DATA_MODE.description: Indicator of whether the data is EXERCISE, REAL, SIMULATED, or TEST.

CREATED_AT.description: Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system.

CREATED_BY.description: Application user who created the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

REFERENCE_FRAME.description: EO observations are assumed to be topocentric J2000 coordinates ('J2000') as defined by the IAU, unless otherwise specified.

SEN_REFERENCE_FRAME.description:
The sensor reference frame is assumed to be the International Terrestrial Reference Frame (ITRF),
unless otherwise specified. (ITRF is equivalent to Earth-Centered Earth-Fixed (ECEF) for this purpose).
Lat / long / height values should be reported using the WGS-84 ellipsoid, where applicable.

UMBRA.description: Boolean indicating that the target object was in umbral eclipse at the time of this observation.

PENUMBRA.description:
Boolean indicating that the target object was in a penumbral eclipse at the time of this observation.
This field is highly recommended if the observations will be used for photometric processing.

ORIG_NETWORK.description: The originating source network on which this record was created, auto-populated by the system.

SOURCE_DL.description: The source from which this record was received.

AZIMUTH_MEASURED.description: True if measured, false if computed. Required if azimuth is reported.

ELEVATION_MEASURED.description: True if measured, false if computed. Required if elevation is reported.

RANGE_MEASURED.description: True if measured, false if computed. Required if range is reported.

RANGERATE_MEASURED.description: True if measured, false if computed. Required if range-rate is reported.

RA_MEASURED.description: True if measured, false if computed. Required if right ascension is reported.

DECLINATION_MEASURED.description: True if measured, false if computed. Required if declination is reported.

NIIRS.description: National Imagery Interpretability Rating Scale (NIIRS). Ranging from 0 (lowest) to 9 (highest).

METERS_PER_PIXEL.description: Ground sample distance in meters per pixel.

IMAGE_SNR.description: Signal-to-noise ratio of the image. Higher values indicate cleaner imagery.

IMAGE_WIDTH.description: Width of the image in pixels.

IMAGE_HEIGHT.description: Height of the image in pixels.

IMAGE_COMPRESSION.description: Compression type used for the image, e.g., "JPEG", "PNG", "RAW", etc.

IMAGE_COMPRESSION_RATIO.description: Compression ratio used (original size / compressed size), if applicable.

PROCESSED_IMAGE_URI.description: URI to the processed image used for this observation.

IMAGE_AUTO_ENHANCED.description: Flag indicating whether the image was auto-enhanced (e.g., contrast stretch, denoise).

MULTI_FRAME_STACKED.description: True if the observation was taken with multiple frames stacked into one image.

SYNTHETIC_TRACKING_USED.description: True if synthetic tracking was used to create the image.

IMAGE_SHARPNESS.description: Sharpness metric of the image based on the Tenengrad method or variance of Laplacian. Higher values indicate sharper images.

IMAGE_NOISE_STDDEV.description: Noise level of the image, estimated via pixel intensity variance in background regions.

IMAGE_CONTRAST.description: Contrast metric of the image, such as Michelson contrast or RMS contrast.

IMAGE_DYNAMIC_RANGE.description: Dynamic range of the image (max pixel value / min pixel value), indicating tonal spread.

IMAGE_ENTROPY.description: Entropy of the image, representing the richness of information content. Higher entropy suggests higher texture detail.

BACKGROUND_UNIFORMITY.description: Background uniformity metric (e.g., mean gradient in background areas). Lower values indicate more uniform background.

BACKGROUND_MEAN_LEVEL.description: Mean background level, computed from non-object regions in pixel units.

SATURATED_PIXEL_PERCENT.description: Percentage of saturated pixels in the image. Indicates overexposure when high.

DEAD_PIXEL_PERCENT.description: Percentage of dead or zero-value pixels in the image. Indicates sensor defects or underexposure.

PSF_FWHM.description: Estimated Point Spread Function (PSF) Full Width at Half Maximum (FWHM) in pixels. Indicates image blur or focus.

CLOUD_COVER_PERCENT.description: Estimated percentage of cloud cover in the image. Derived using cloud detection algorithms such as Fmask or machine learning classifiers.

CLOUD_DETECTION_CONFIDENCE.description: Confidence score of the cloud detection result, from 0 (low confidence) to 1 (high confidence).

HAZE_PERCENT.description: Estimated percentage of the image obscured by haze or atmospheric scattering effects.

AEROSOL_OPTICAL_THICKNESS.description: Estimated aerosol optical thickness (AOT) at 550 nm, indicating particulate matter in the atmosphere affecting image clarity.

WATER_VAPOR_CONTENT.description: Estimated water vapor content (e.g., total column precipitable water) at the time of imaging, in mm.

SUN_ELEVATION.description: Sun elevation angle at the time of image capture, in degrees above the horizon.

SUN_AZIMUTH.description: Sun azimuth angle at the time of image capture, in degrees from true north.

VIEW_ZENITH_ANGLE.description: View zenith angle (sensor line-of-sight angle from nadir), in degrees.

VIEW_AZIMUTH_ANGLE.description: View azimuth angle (direction of sensor relative to north), in degrees.

OFF_NADIR_ANGLE.description: Off-nadir angle of the sensor at the time of image capture, in degrees.

SWATH_WIDTH_KM.description: Ground coverage width of the image swath in kilometers.

MEAN_TERRAIN_ELEVATION.description: Mean terrain elevation in the image footprint, in meters above sea level.

TERRAIN_ELEVATION_STDDEV.description: Standard deviation of terrain elevation in the image footprint, in meters.

SHADOW_COVER_PERCENT.description: Percentage of the image affected by shadows, derived via topographic or object shadow detection.

SUNGLINT_PRESENT.description: Flag indicating whether sunglint is present in the image (true if high reflectance from water surface due to sun geometry).

SUNGLINT_PERCENT.description: Percentage of image affected by sunglint.

SNOW_ICE_COVER_PERCENT.description: Estimated percentage of snow or ice coverage in the image footprint.

VALID_DATA_AREA_KM2.description: Total area covered by valid data (non-masked, usable imagery) in square kilometers.

MJD.description: Modified Julian Date in UTC, e.g., 58119

X_POLE_WANDER_RADIANS.description: x component of Pole Wander in radians, e.g., 2.872908911518888E-7

Y_POLE_WANDER_RADIANS.description: y component of Pole Wander in radians, e.g., 1.2003259523750447E-6

X_CELESTIAL_POLE_OFFSET_RADIANS.description: x component of Celestial Pole Offset in radians, e.g., 5.720801437092525E-10

Y_CELESTIAL_POLE_OFFSET_RADIANS.description: y component of Celestial Pole Offset in radians, e.g., -8.484239419416879E-10

UT1_MINUS_UTC_SECONDS.description: UT1 minus UTC in seconds, e.g., 0.2163567

TAI_MINUS_UTC_SECONDS.description: TAI minus UTC in seconds, e.g., 37

LENGTH_OF_DAY_CORRECTION_SECONDS.description: Correction to Length of Day in seconds, e.g., 8.094E-4

LONGITUDE_MIN.description: Western longitude boundary of slot (degrees east)

LONGITUDE_MAX.description: Eastern longitude boundary of slot (degrees east)

LOST_FLAG.description: True if object is lost/not tracked

SIGNAL.description: Signal type code (e.g., L1C, L2P, L5Q, E1B)

VALUE.description: Observation value (units depend on type: m, cycles, Hz, dB-Hz)

GNSS_SAT_ID.description: GNSS satellite identifier (e.g., G01, R24, E05, C03)

ALTITUDE.description: Receiver altitude in meters above WGS-84

ROW_INDICATORS.description: Row indicators for the hypothesis matrix

COL_INDICATORS.description: Column indicators for the hypothesis matrix

MATRIX.description: Matrix data as a boolean array in row major format; if overflow, adds additional rows

ANALYSIS_METHOD.description: Analysis methodology used to form the hypothesis

DENSITIES.description: Electron densities at each altitude in electrons/m^3

FOES.description: foEs sporadic E critical frequency in MHz

HMF2.description: hmF2 peak height of F2 layer in km

HMF1.description: hmF1 peak height of F1 layer in km

HME.description: hmE peak height of E layer in km

NMF2.description: NmF2 peak density of F2 layer in electrons/m^3

Geometry.description: Geometry table with information about geometric properties

ID.description: Unique identifier for the site, BE_NUMBER

SITE_TYPE.description: Site type as defined in SiteType enum

CTR_ID.description: CTR ISO 3166 Numeric code as string

CREATED_BY.description: Identifier of the user who created the site data

MODEL_URL.description: URL for the 3D model of the site

TASKABLE.description: Indicates if the site is taskable

OPERATIONAL_STATUS.description: Operational status of the site (e.g., active, inactive, under construction)

FUEL_TYPE.description: Fuel Type Used in This Stage

THRUST.description: Thrust Produced by This Stage (in Newtons)
Thrust Produced by the Sustainer (in Newtons)
Thrust Produced by the Engine (in Newtons)

OPERATIONS_POINTS_OF_CONTACT.description: Operations Points of Contact for Launch

MISSION_TYPE.description: Type of the Mission (e.g., Test Flight, Satellite Deployment)

WEATHER_CONDITIONS.description: Weather and Environmental Conditions at Launch

LAUNCH_STATUS.description: Launch Outcome and Status (e.g., Successful, Failed)

MEDIA_LINKS.description: Media Links Related to the Launch

COLA_SCREEN_DURATION.description: Duration of Collision Avoidance Screen (in Seconds)

COLA_RUNS_REQUIRED.description: Number of Required Collision Avoidance Runs

COLA_POINTS_OF_CONTACT.description: Points of Contact for Collision Avoidance

BURN_OUT_VECTORS.description: Burn Out Vectors for the Launch

HIGH_ZENITH_AZIMUTH.description: True if high zenith angle observation

SAT_NO.description: Satellite catalog number of launched object

DERIVED_FROM.description: Source record this event was derived from

TARGET_ORBIT.description: Target orbit type (LEO, MEO, GEO, HEO, SSO, etc.)

OBJECTS_ON_ORBIT.description: Number of objects placed on orbit

RA_OF_ASC_NODE.description: Right ascension of ascending node in degrees

EVENT_EPOCH.description: Event epoch that spawned the manifold (ISO 8601)

SOURCE.description: Source of detection (sensor ID or method)

ORIG_SEMI_MAJOR_AXIS.description: Original pre-event semi-major axis in km

ENTITY_ID.description: Unique ID as a String [no units]

EPOCH.description: Epoch of Mean Keplerian elements (UNIX timestamp) [numeric seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00 UTC]

MEAN_MOTION.description: Mean motion in rev/day [M if chosen to represent orbit size for SGP/SGP4 elements]

RA_OF_ASC_NODE.description: Right ascension of ascending node in degrees

BSTAR.description: SGP/SGP4 drag-like coefficient (BSTAR) in units of 1/[Earth radii]

MEAN_ELEMENT_THEORY.description: Description of the Mean Element Theory (SGP4, DSST, USM)

BOOSTING.description: True if object is in boost phase

DROP_PT_IND.description: True if drop point indicator set

VECTOR_COMPONENTS.description: Number of components per vector (default 6: X, Y, Z, VX, VY, VZ)

VECTORS.description: Vector data as flat array [X0, Y0, Z0, VX0, VY0, VZ0, X1, ...]

AOU_RPT.description: AOU report data as flat array

LAUNCH_AOU.description: Launch AOU data as flat array

IMPACT_AOU.description: Impact AOU data as flat array

odSensorContribution.description: Sensor contribution to an orbit determination solution

NUM_ACCEPTED.description: Number of accepted observations from this sensor

NUM_REJECTED.description: Number of rejected observations from this sensor

WRMS.description: Weighted RMS for this sensor's observations

INITIAL_OD.description: True if this is an initial orbit determination

APRIORI_ELSET.description: A priori element set data reference

APRIORI_STATE_VECTOR.description: A priori state vector data reference

BALLISTIC_COEFF_EST.description: True if ballistic coefficient was estimated

AGOM_EST.description: True if area-to-mass ratio was estimated

CCSDS_OCM_VERS.description: Format version in the form of 'x.y', where 'y' is incremented for minor changes, and 'x' for major changes.

COMMENT.description: Comments (a contiguous set of one or more comment lines may be provided immediately after the version number).

CLASSIFICATION.description: User-defined free-text message classification/caveats of this OCM.

MESSAGE_ID.description: Free-text field containing an ID that uniquely identifies a message from this originator.

OBJECT_NAME.description: Free-text field containing the name of the object.

INTERNATIONAL_DESIGNATOR.description: International designator for the object as assigned by COSPAR.

CATALOG_NAME.description: Satellite catalog source from which 'OBJECT_DESIGNATOR' was obtained.

OBJECT_DESIGNATOR.description: Unique satellite identification designator from the catalog.

ALTERNATE_NAMES.description: Alternate names of this space object.

ORIGINATOR_POC.description: Originator or programmatic Point-of-Contact (PoC) for OCM.

ORIGINATOR_POSITION.description: Contact position of the originator PoC.

TECH_ORG.description: Creating agency or operator for technical contact.

TECH_POSITION.description: Contact position of the technical PoC.

PREVIOUS_MESSAGE_ID.description: ID that uniquely identifies the previous message from this originator.

NEXT_MESSAGE_ID.description: ID that uniquely identifies the next message from this originator.

ADM_MSG_LINK.description: Unique identifier of Attitude Data Messages linked to this OCM.

CDM_MSG_LINK.description: Unique identifier of Conjunction Data Messages linked to this OCM.

PRM_MSG_LINK.description: Unique identifier of Pointing Request Messages linked to this OCM.

RDM_MSG_LINK.description: Unique identifier of Reentry Data Messages linked to this OCM.

TDM_MSG_LINK.description: List of Tracking Data Messages upon which this orbit determination is based.

COUNTRY.description: Country where the space object owner is based.

CONSTELLATION.description: Name of the constellation to which this space object belongs.

OBJECT_TYPE.description: Specification of the type of object (e.g., PAYLOAD, ROCKET BODY, DEBRIS).

TIME_SYSTEM.description: Time system for all absolute time stamps in this OCM, including EPOCH_TZERO.

EPOCH_TZERO.description: Default epoch to which all relative times are referenced in data blocks.

OPS_STATUS.description: Specification of the operational status of the space object.

ORBIT_CATEGORY.description: Specification of the type of orbit (e.g., GEO, LEO).

OCM_DATA_ELEMENTS.description: List of elements of information data blocks included in this message.

SCLK_OFFSET_AT_EPOCH.description: Number of spacecraft clock counts at EPOCH_TZERO (used if TIME_SYSTEM is SCLK).

SCLK_SEC_PER_SI_SEC.description: Number of clock seconds occurring during one SI second (used if TIME_SYSTEM is SCLK).

PREVIOUS_MESSAGE_EPOCH.description: Creation epoch of the previous message from this originator.

NEXT_MESSAGE_EPOCH.description: Anticipated (or actual) epoch of the next message from this originator.

START_TIME.description: Time of the earliest data contained in the OCM.

STOP_TIME.description: Time of the latest data contained in the OCM.

TIME_SPAN.description: Span of time that the OCM covers, measured in days.

TAIMUTC_AT_TZERO.description: Difference (TAI - UTC) in seconds at EPOCH_TZERO.

NEXT_LEAP_TAIMUTC.description: Difference (TAI - UTC) in seconds at NEXT_LEAP_EPOCH.

UT1MUTC_AT_TZERO.description: Difference (UT1 - UTC) in seconds at EPOCH_TZERO.

EOP_SOURCE.description: Source and version of Earth Orientation Parameters used.

INTERP_METHOD_EOP.description: Method used to select or interpolate sequential EOP data.

CELESTIAL_SOURCE.description: Source and version of celestial body ephemeris data used.

X.description: X component of position in the specified reference frame.

COMMENT.description: Comments in the Physical Properties section.

WET_MASS.description: Wet mass of the space object.

DRY_MASS.description: Dry mass of the space object.

OEB_Q1.description: Quaternion component q1 of orientation from OEB to EME2000.

OEB_MAX.description: Maximum dimension of the object along OEB frame axes.

OEB_INT.description: Intermediate dimension along OEB frame axes.

OEB_MIN.description: Minimum dimension of the object along OEB frame axes.

SRP_CONST_AREA.description: Constant area for solar radiation pressure computations.

SRP_UNCERTAINTY.description: Uncertainty in the solar radiation pressure coefficient.

GM.description: Gravitational constant times the mass of the central body.

N_BODY_PERTURBATIONS.description: List of celestial bodies included in n-body perturbations.

FIXED_F10P7.description: Fixed F10.7 solar flux value used.

FIXED_F10P7_MEAN.description: Fixed mean F10.7 solar flux value used.

MAN_BASIS.description: Basis of the maneuver plan (e.g., planned, predicted, estimated).

MAN_REF_FRAME.description: Reference frame for the maneuver data.

MAN_FRAME_EPOCH.description: Epoch of the maneuver reference frame.

MAN_UNITS.description: Units for the maneuver data values.

OD_ID.description: Unique identifier for the orbit determination.

OD_PREV_ID.description: Identifier of the previous orbit determination.

OD_TIME_TAG.description: Time tag of the orbit determination.

OD_OBSERVATIONS_TYPE.description: Types of observations used (e.g., RANGE, DOPPLER).

OD_APRIORI_DATA.description: A priori data used for orbit determination.

STATE_STEP_SIZE.description: Time interval between state vectors in seconds (required for time-series data).

STATE_VECTOR_SIZE.description:
Number of components per state vector.
6 = position + velocity (X, Y, Z, X_DOT, Y_DOT, Z_DOT)
9 = position + velocity + acceleration (adds X_DDOT, Y_DDOT, Z_DDOT)

STATE_DATA.description:
State data as row-major array of doubles.
Layout: [X0, Y0, Z0, X_DOT0, Y_DOT0, Z_DOT0, X1, Y1, Z1, ...]
Time reconstruction: epoch[i] = METADATA.START_TIME + (i * STATE_STEP_SIZE)
Length must be divisible by STATE_VECTOR_SIZE.

COVARIANCE_DATA.description:
Covariance data as flat array (21 elements per epoch for 6x6 lower triangular).
Time alignment matches STATE_DATA epochs.

PHYSICAL_PROPERTIES.description: Physical properties of the space object.

ephemerisDataLine.description:
A single ephemeris data line (for non-uniform time steps only)
Use this format when time intervals between states are irregular.
For uniform time steps, use the compact EPHEMERIS_DATA array instead.

EPOCH.description: Epoch time, in ISO 8601 UTC format (required for non-uniform steps)

OBJECT.description: Satellite name for the first object

CENTER_NAME.description: Origin of reference frame (EARTH, MARS, MOON, etc.)

REFERENCE_FRAME.description: Name of the reference frame (TEME, EME2000, etc.)

REFERENCE_FRAME_EPOCH.description: Epoch of reference frame, if not intrinsic to the definition of the reference frame

COV_REFERENCE_FRAME.description: Reference frame for the covariance matrix

TIME_SYSTEM.description: Time system used for the orbit state and covariance matrix. (UTC)

START_TIME.description: Start of TOTAL time span covered by ephemeris data and covariance data (ISO 8601)

USEABLE_START_TIME.description: Optional start USEABLE time span covered by ephemeris data (ISO 8601)

USEABLE_STOP_TIME.description: Optional end of USEABLE time span covered by ephemeris data (ISO 8601)

STOP_TIME.description: End of TOTAL time span covered by ephemeris data and covariance data (ISO 8601)

INTERPOLATION.description: Recommended interpolation method for ephemeris data (Hermite, Linear, Lagrange, etc.)

INTERPOLATION_DEGREE.description: Recommended interpolation degree for ephemeris data

STEP_SIZE.description:
Time interval between ephemeris states in seconds.
If > 0: Use compact EPHEMERIS_DATA array (times are implicit).
If 0 or omitted: Use EPHEMERIS_DATA_LINES with explicit epochs.

STATE_VECTOR_SIZE.description:
Number of components per state vector in EPHEMERIS_DATA array.
6 = position + velocity (X, Y, Z, X_DOT, Y_DOT, Z_DOT)
9 = position + velocity + acceleration (adds X_DDOT, Y_DDOT, Z_DDOT)
Only used when STEP_SIZE > 0. Default is 6.

EPHEMERIS_DATA.description:
Compact ephemeris data as row-major array of doubles.
Only used when STEP_SIZE > 0.
Layout: [x0,y0,z0,xdot0,ydot0,zdot0, x1,y1,z1,xdot1,ydot1,zdot1, ...]
Units: position in km, velocity in km/s, acceleration in km/s
Length must be divisible by STATE_VECTOR_SIZE.
Number of states = length(EPHEMERIS_DATA) / STATE_VECTOR_SIZE

EPHEMERIS_DATA_LINES.description:
Array of ephemeris data lines with explicit epochs.
Only used when STEP_SIZE == 0 or omitted (non-uniform time steps).
Each line contains its own EPOCH timestamp.

CLASSIFICATION.description:
OEM Header
Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

EPOCH.description: EPOCH of Mean Keplerian elements (ISO 8601 UTC format)

SEMI_MAJOR_AXIS.description: Semi-major axis in km or Mean Motion in rev/day

MEAN_MOTION.description: Mean motion in rev/day if MEAN_ELEMENT_THEORY=SGP/SGP4 else unused

EPHEMERIS_TYPE.description:
TLE Related Parameters (Only if MEAN_ELEMENT_THEORY=SGP/SGP4)
EPHEMERIS_TYPE Default=0

BSTAR.description: BSTAR in 1/Earth radii or BTERM in m**2/kg depending on MEAN_ELEMENT_THEORY [C]

MEAN_MOTION_DOT.description: MEAN_MOTION_DOT in rev/day**2 [C if SGP or PPT3]

MEAN_MOTION_DDOT.description: MEAN_MOTION_DDOT in rev/day**3 if SGP/PPT3 or AGOM in m**2/kg if SGP4-XP [C]

COV_REFERENCE_FRAME.description:
Position/Velocity Covariance Matrix (6x6 Lower Triangular) [C if any covariance provided]
COV_REF_FRAME reference frame for covariance [C if covariance given]
Typically RSW

COVARIANCE.description:
Covariance matrix as flat array (6x6 lower triangular = 21 elements).
Order: [CX_X, CY_X, CY_Y, CZ_X, CZ_Y, CZ_Z,
CX_DOT_X, CX_DOT_Y, CX_DOT_Z, CX_DOT_X_DOT,
CY_DOT_X, CY_DOT_Y, CY_DOT_Z, CY_DOT_X_DOT, CY_DOT_Y_DOT,
CZ_DOT_X, CZ_DOT_Y, CZ_DOT_Z, CZ_DOT_X_DOT, CZ_DOT_Y_DOT, CZ_DOT_Z_DOT]
Units: position in km**2, velocity in km**2/s**2, cross in km**2/s

ANTENNA_TYPE.description: Antenna type (e.g., PARABOLIC, PHASED_ARRAY, HORN, HELICAL, DIPOLE, PATCH, YAGI)

QUANTITY.description: Number of antennas of this type

BAND.description: Operating frequency band (e.g., UHF, L, S, C, X, Ku, Ka, V, W)

APERTURE.description: Antenna diameter or aperture in meters

POLARIZATION.description: Polarization type (e.g., LINEAR, CIRCULAR, DUAL, RHCP, LHCP)

SLEW_RATE.description: Maximum slew rate in degrees per second

PURPOSE.description: Purpose or function (e.g., TT_C, PAYLOAD, CROSSLINK, GPS)

CHEMISTRY.description: Battery chemistry (e.g., LI_ION, NICD, NIMH, LIPO, SILVER_ZINC)

QUANTITY.description: Number of batteries of this type

MAX_DOD.description: Maximum depth of discharge as fraction (0.0-1.0)

STATE_OF_HEALTH.description: Current state of health as fraction (0.0-1.0)

DERIVED_FROM.description: Source record this was derived from

GEO_POSITION.description: GEO longitude at event time (degrees east)

DESCRIPTION.description: Description of why object is of interest

CELL_TYPE.description: Solar cell type (e.g., SILICON, GAAS, MULTI_JUNCTION, THIN_FILM, PEROVSKITE)

QUANTITY.description: Number of solar arrays of this type

AREA.description: Total array area in square meters

POWER_BOL.description: Beginning of life power output in Watts

POWER_EOL.description: End of life power output in Watts

DEGRADATION_RATE.description: Degradation rate per year as fraction

QUANTITY.description: Number of thrusters of this type

PROPELLANT.description: Propellant type (e.g., HYDRAZINE, XENON, KRYPTON, MMH_NTO, N2, GN2)

IS_STABLE.description: Indicates whether the observation is stable or not

OBJECT_ID.description: Unique identifier for the object being observed

PASS_DURATION.description: Duration of the observation pass in seconds

NAME.description: Function name as exported from WASM

WASM_HASH.description: SHA256 hash of the decrypted WASM binary

WASM_SIZE.description: Size of WASM binary in bytes

WASM_CID.description: IPFS CID of the encrypted WASM binary

ENTRY_FUNCTIONS.description: Entry point functions exported by the plugin

REQUIRED_SCHEMAS.description: FlatBuffer schemas required by this plugin

PROVIDER_PEER_ID.description: Peer ID of the plugin provider

PROVIDER_EPM_CID.description: IPFS CID of provider's EPM (Entity Profile Message)

ENCRYPTED.description: Whether the WASM binary is encrypted

CREATED_AT.description: Unix timestamp when plugin was created

UPDATED_AT.description: Unix timestamp when plugin was last updated

SIGNATURE.description: Ed25519 signature from provider over manifest

PLK.description:
Plugin License Key - Issued license for plugin access
Uses ECIES: both parties derive symmetric key via X25519 ECDH
Key derivation: X25519(private, peer_public)  HKDF-SHA256  AES-256-GCM

PLUGIN_ID.description: Plugin ID this license is for

ISSUER_PUBKEY.description:
Issuer's X25519 public key (32 bytes)
Used with licensee's private key to derive shared secret via ECDH

ISSUED_AT.description: Unix timestamp when license was issued

VALID_FROM.description: Unix timestamp when license becomes valid

EXPIRES_AT.description: Unix timestamp when license expires (0 = never expires)

ISSUER_PEER_ID.description: Peer ID of the license issuer (OrbPro)

SIGNATURE.description: Ed25519 signature from issuer over all fields (except SIGNATURE)

HD_KEY_PATH.description: Hierarchical Deterministic (HD) derivation path for the program's key, used in cryptocurrency wallets

MESSAGE_TYPES.description: Vector of standard message types used by the program

USERS.description: Vector of users associated with the program, each user can have assigned message types

PUR.description: Purchase Request - Request to purchase data from a storefront listing

REQUEST_ID.description: Unique identifier for this purchase request

LISTING_ID.description: ID of the listing being purchased

TIER_NAME.description: Name of the pricing tier selected

BUYER_ENCRYPTION_PUBKEY.description: Buyer's encryption public key for encrypted delivery

REENTRY_EPOCH_UNC.description: Reentry epoch uncertainty window in hours

PREV_PREDICTION_EPOCH.description: Previous predicted reentry epoch for comparison (ISO 8601)

SOLAR_RAD_AREA.description: Solar radiation pressure area in m^2

REV.description: Review - User review of a storefront listing

LISTING_ID.description: ID of the listing being reviewed

ACL_GRANT_ID.description: ACL grant ID proving purchase (proof of purchase)

PLATFORM_TYPE.description: Platform type (e.g., SHIP, AIRCRAFT, GROUND, SATELLITE)

BAND.description: Operating band (e.g., HF, VHF, UHF, L, S, C, X, Ku, Ka)

OPERATING_BAND.description: Operating RF band (e.g., X, C, L, S, P)

FORECAST.description: True if this is a forecast

DERIVED.description: True if derived from other measurements

SEN_ENERGY_LEVEL.description: Energy level or range (keV or MeV)

SEN_QUAT.description: Sensor quaternion (scalar-last: q1, q2, q3, q0)

CHANGE_DETECTED.description: True if change detected from baseline

BRIGHTNESS_VARIANCE_CHANGE_DETECTED.description: True if brightness variance change detected

SOLAR_PHASE_ANGLE_BRIGHTNESS_CHANGE_DETE.description: True if solar phase angle brightness change detected

KP1.description: Planetary 3-hour Range Index (Kp) for 0000-0300 UT, multiplied by 10

KP2.description: Planetary 3-hour Range Index (Kp) for 0300-0600 UT, multiplied by 10

KP3.description: Planetary 3-hour Range Index (Kp) for 0600-0900 UT, multiplied by 10

KP4.description: Planetary 3-hour Range Index (Kp) for 0900-1200 UT, multiplied by 10

KP5.description: Planetary 3-hour Range Index (Kp) for 1200-1500 UT, multiplied by 10

KP6.description: Planetary 3-hour Range Index (Kp) for 1500-1800 UT, multiplied by 10

KP7.description: Planetary 3-hour Range Index (Kp) for 1800-2100 UT, multiplied by 10

KP8.description: Planetary 3-hour Range Index (Kp) for 2100-0000 UT, multiplied by 10

KP_SUM.description: Sum of the 8 Kp indices for the day

AP_AVG.description: Arithmetic average of the 8 Ap indices for the day

POS_UNC_FLAG.description: True if position uncertainty is flagged

PM_UNC_FLAG.description: True if proper motion uncertainty is flagged

MULT_FLAG.description: True if star is in a multiple system

NEIGHBOR_FLAG.description: True if nearest neighbor is within confusion radius

SHIFT_FLAG.description: True if position shift detected between catalogs

OBSERVER_ID.description: Unique identifier for the observation OBSERVER -  [Specific CCSDS Document]

OBSERVER_X.description: Cartesian X coordinate of the OBSERVER location in chosen reference frame

OBSERVER_Y.description: Cartesian Y coordinate of the OBSERVER location in chosen reference frame

OBSERVER_Z.description: Cartesian Z coordinate of the OBSERVER location in chosen reference frame

OBSERVER_VX.description: Cartesian X coordinate of the OBSERVER velocity in chosen reference frame

OBSERVER_VY.description: Cartesian Y coordinate of the OBSERVER velocity in chosen reference frame

OBSERVER_VZ.description: Cartesian Z coordinate of the OBSERVER velocity in chosen reference frame

OBSERVER_POSITION_REFERENCE_FRAME.description: Reference frame used for OBSERVER location Cartesian coordinates (e.g., ECEF, ECI)

OBS_REFERENCE_FRAME.description: Reference frame used for obs location Cartesian coordinates (e.g., ECEF, ECI)

EPOCH.description: Epoch time or observation time, in ISO 8601 UTC format -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1

OBSERVATION_STEP_SIZE.description:
Time interval between observations in seconds (required).
Time reconstruction: time[i] = OBSERVATION_START_TIME + (i * OBSERVATION_STEP_SIZE)

OBSERVATION_START_TIME.description: Start time for observation time reconstruction (ISO 8601 UTC format).

CCSDS_TDM_VERS.description: TDM version number -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

COMMENT.description: Comments regarding TDM -  various sections, e.g., Page D-9

CREATION_DATE.description: Date of TDM creation -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

ORIGINATOR.description: Originator of the TDM -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

META_START.description: Start of metadata section -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

TIME_SYSTEM.description: Time system used -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

START_TIME.description: Start time of the data -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

STOP_TIME.description: Stop time of the data -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

PARTICIPANT_1.description: First participant in the TDM -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

PARTICIPANT_2.description: Second participant in the TDM -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

PARTICIPANT_3.description: Third participant in the TDM (if applicable) -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

PARTICIPANT_4.description: Fourth participant in the TDM (if applicable) -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

PARTICIPANT_5.description: Fifth participant in the TDM (if applicable) -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9, max participants

MODE.description: Mode of TDM -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

PATH_1.description: First path in TDM -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

PATH_2.description: Second path in TDM (if applicable) -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

META_STOP.description: End of metadata section -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

DATA_START.description: Start of data section -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

TRANSMIT_FREQ_1.description: Transmit frequency for first participant -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

DATA_STOP.description: End of data section -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-9

TIMETAG_REF.description:
Additional properties as required by the specific application of the TDM...
Reference for time tagging -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-10

ANGLE_TYPE.description:
Type of angle data -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-12
Can be AZEL, RADEC, XEYN, XSYE, or another value with provided ICD

ANGLE_1.description: First angle value -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-12

ANGLE_2.description: Second angle value -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-12

RANGE_RATE.description: Rate of change of range -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1

RANGE_MODE.description: Mode of range data -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-10

RANGE_MODULUS.description: Modulus value for range data -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-10

CORRECTION_ANGLE_1.description: First correction angle -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-12

CORRECTION_ANGLE_2.description: Second correction angle -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-12

CORRECTIONS_APPLIED.description: Indicator of corrections applied -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-12

TROPO_DRY.description: Dry component of tropospheric delay -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-14

TROPO_WET.description: Wet component of tropospheric delay -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-14

STEC.description: Slant total electron content -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-13

CLOCK_BIAS.description: Clock bias values -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-15

CLOCK_DRIFT.description: Clock drift values -  CCSDS 503.0-B-1, Page D-15

MULTI_SOURCE.description: True if fused from multiple sources

TRACK_COMPONENTS.description: Number of components per point (default 3 for X, Y, Z)

ECEF_POS.description: ECEF position as flat array [X0, Y0, Z0, X1, Y1, Z1, ...]

ECEF_VEL.description: ECEF velocity as flat array [VX0, VY0, VZ0, VX1, VY1, VZ1, ...]

ECEF_ACC.description: ECEF acceleration as flat array [AX0, AY0, AZ0, AX1, AY1, AZ1, ...]

LC_POS.description: Local coordinate position as flat array

LC_VEL.description: Local coordinate velocity as flat array

LC_ACC.description: Local coordinate acceleration as flat array

COV.description: Covariance data (21 elements per point for 6x6 lower triangular)

ERR_ELLP.description: Error ellipse data (6 elements per point)

propagatorConfig.description: Propagator configuration structure to describe propagation settings

uvwSigmas.description: UVW Sigmas (Covariance matrix in UVW frame)

VCMAtmosphericModelData.description: VCM Atmospheric and Perturbation Model Data

COVARIANCE.description:
Covariance matrix as flat array (6x6 lower triangular = 21 elements).
Order: [CX_X, CY_X, CY_Y, CZ_X, CZ_Y, CZ_Z,
CX_DOT_X, CX_DOT_Y, CX_DOT_Z, CX_DOT_X_DOT,
CY_DOT_X, CY_DOT_Y, CY_DOT_Z, CY_DOT_X_DOT, CY_DOT_Y_DOT,
CZ_DOT_X, CZ_DOT_Y, CZ_DOT_Z, CZ_DOT_X_DOT, CZ_DOT_Y_DOT, CZ_DOT_Z_DOT]
Units: position in km**2, velocity in km**2/s**2, cross in km**2/s

SIZE_IN_BITS.description: Number of bits for this integer

MAX_SIZE_IN_BITS.description: Maximum size in bits (for variable length)
Maximum size in bits (for variable length)

LEADING_SIZE_BITS.description: Leading size field bits (for variable length)

PolynomialCalibrator.description: Polynomial calibrator - converts raw to engineering using polynomial

COEFFICIENTS.description: Polynomial terms (index is power, value is coefficient)

POINTS.description: Spline points ordered by raw value

MathOperation.description: Mathematical operation for math operation calibrator

MATCH_CRITERIA.description: Match criteria for selecting this calibrator
Match criteria for this alarm context

USE_CALIBRATED_VALUE.description: Use calibrated value (true) or raw value (false)

ARRAY_TYPE_REF.description: Reference to the array element type

OFFSET_IN_BITS.description: Offset in bits from reference location

ContainerEntry.description: Container entry list item (union of entry types)

RateInStream.description: Rate specification for container in stream

ArgumentRefEntry.description: Argument reference entry in command container

CONTAINER_REFS.description: Container references provided by this service

COMMAND_REFS.description: Command references accepted by this service

XTC.description:
SpaceSystem - Root element for XTCE document
A SpaceSystem defines the telemetry and command configuration for a space
vehicle or subsystem. SpaceSystems can be nested hierarchically to represent
the structure of a spacecraft (e.g., spacecraft -> subsystem -> payload).

Record.description: Individual record wrapper for any standard type

value.description: The record data (union of all supported standards)

RECORDS.description: Array of heterogeneous records from any supported standard
